mlr3mbspls 0.2.12

Multi-Block Sparse PCA (MB-sPCA) Transformer

Source: R/PipeOpMBsPCA.R
PipeOpMBsPCA.Rd

PipeOpMBsPCA extracts up to ncomp sparse principal components from multiple, predefined feature blocks. Each component is estimated with a GSMV-style algorithm (cpp_mbspca_one_lv()), and after extraction a block-wise rank-1 deflation is applied so later components capture novel structure. Optionally, a permutation test (perm_test_component_mbspca()) can stop extraction early if a component explains no more variance than expected under the null.

The operator appends one column per block x component (name: PC<k>_<block>) to the feature table.

Value

  • Training: appends latent score columns and sets $state as described.

  • Prediction: appends latent score columns computed from stored weights.

  • Plot methods: return a ggplot object.

Details

Multi-Block Sparse PCA (MB-sPCA) PipeOp

During training, non-numeric or constant features are silently removed from each block. If c_matrix is supplied, its number of columns determines the maximum number of components (overrides ncomp). Deflation is performed block-wise after each component.

Input and Output

  • Input: mlr3::Task with a table of numeric features (non-numeric or constant features inside a block are dropped automatically).

  • Output: the input task with additional columns containing the latent scores for each block & component.

State

The $state stores:

  • blocks: the (sanitised) named list of block -> feature names used.

  • ncomp: number of retained components.

  • weights: list(PCk -> list(block -> numeric named vector)).

  • loadings: same shape as weights, block-wise loadings used for deflation.

  • ev_block: matrix [components x blocks] of variance explained by each PC within each block.

  • ev_comp: numeric vector of total variance explained by each PC.

  • T_mat: numeric matrix of appended latent scores (column names match the appended features).

Parameters (ParamSet)

  • blocks (uty, required; tag "train"): named list mapping block IDs to character vectors of feature names.

  • ncomp (int, default 1; tag "train"): number of components to target (may be shortened by permutation early-stopping).

  • permutation_test (lgl, default FALSE; tag "train"): enable early-stop test.

  • n_perm (int, default 500; tag "train"): permutations for the test.

  • perm_alpha (dbl in [0,1], default 0.05; tag "train"): test alpha.

  • c_<block> (one dbl per block, lower 1, upper sqrt(#features in block), default sqrt(#features); tags c("train","tune")): sqrt(L1-budget) for that block.

  • c_matrix (uty, default NULL; tags c("train","tune")): optional matrix (blocks x components) overriding single-value c_<block> parameters.

Methods

  • $plot_variance(): stacked bar chart of ev_block.

  • $plot_loadings(top_n = 20, palette = "Dark2"): bar plots of top sparse loadings per block/component.

  • $plot_scree(type = c("component","cumulative")): scree/cumulative EV.

  • $plot_score_heatmap(method = "spearman"): heat-map of score correlations.

  • $plot_score_network(cutoff = 0.3, method = "spearman"): network of score correlations with |r| >= cutoff.

Construction

PipeOpMBsPCA$new(id = "mbspca", blocks, param_vals = list())

See also

mlr3pipelines::PipeOp, mlr3tuning::mlr3tuning, TunerSeqMBsPCA

Super classes

mlr3pipelines::PipeOp -> mlr3pipelines::PipeOpTaskPreproc -> PipeOpMBsPCA

Public fields

blocks

Named list mapping block names to feature columns (kept for predict()).

Method new()

Create a new PipeOpMBsPCA.

Usage

PipeOpMBsPCA$new(id = "mbspca", blocks, param_vals = list())

Arguments

id

character(1). Identifier (default: "mbspca").

blocks

named list. Block -> character() of feature names (required).

param_vals

list. Initial ParamSet values.

Method plot_variance()

Stacked bar plot of block-wise variance explained per component (training).

Usage

PipeOpMBsPCA$plot_variance()

Returns

A ggplot object.

Method plot_loadings()

Bar-plot of sparse loadings (top features) per block & component.

Usage

PipeOpMBsPCA$plot_loadings(top_n = 20, palette = "Dark2")

Arguments

top_n

integer(1). Number of features to show per block/component (default 20).

palette

character(1) or character(2). Brewer palette name, or 2 custom fill colors (pos/neg).

Returns

A ggplot object.

Method plot_scree()

Scree or cumulative variance-explained plot (training).

Usage

PipeOpMBsPCA$plot_scree(type = c("component", "cumulative"))

Arguments

type

character(1). One of "component" or "cumulative".

Returns

A ggplot object.

Method plot_score_heatmap()

Heat-map of score correlations across appended PC score columns.

Usage

PipeOpMBsPCA$plot_score_heatmap(method = "spearman")

Arguments

method

character(1). Correlation method, e.g. "spearman" (default) or "pearson".

Returns

A ggplot object.

Method plot_score_network()

Network of score correlations between PCs with |r| above a cutoff.

Usage

PipeOpMBsPCA$plot_score_network(cutoff = 0.3, method = "spearman")

Arguments

cutoff

numeric(1). Absolute correlation threshold in [0, 1] (default 0.3).

method

character(1). Correlation method, e.g. "spearman" (default) or "pearson".

Returns

A ggplot object.

Method clone()

The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

Usage

PipeOpMBsPCA$clone(deep = FALSE)

Arguments

deep

Whether to make a deep clone.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
library(mlr3)
library(mlr3pipelines)
task = tsk("mtcars")
blocks = list(eng = c("disp", "hp", "drat"),
  body = c("wt", "qsec"))
po = PipeOpMBsPCA$new(blocks = blocks, param_vals = list(ncomp = 2))
g = as_graph(po)
g$train(task)
print(po$plot_scree())
} # }
